dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Is Elon Musk's billion-dollar fortune now making him look like the pauper of the tech world?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Is Elon Musk's billion-dollar fortune now making him look like the pauper of the tech world?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, compared to the Brin family's collective two billion, he's uh, actually doing a bit better, surprisingly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, compared to the Brin family's collective two billion, he's uh, actually doing a bit better, surprisingly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but that Brin fortune took a ten billion dollar hit in just one day after Google's stock crashed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but that Brin fortune took a ten billion dollar hit in just one day after Google's stock crashed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that quarterly loss report really did a number on them—stock dropped nearly 10% by 1:15 PM Eastern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that quarterly loss report really did a number on them-stock dropped nearly ten percent by one fifteen p m Eastern.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's wild that Mark Zuckerberg lost his title as the poorest man in the world to Bill Gates over this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's wild that Mark Zuckerberg lost his title as the poorest man in the world to Bill Gates over this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, it's all relative, right? But Google's fast-food delivery struggles aren't helping—only available in 4% of America?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, it's all relative, right? But Google's fast-food delivery struggles aren't helping-only available in four percent of America?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and with just 18 pickup locations, they're not exactly competing with McDonald's or Taco Bell.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and with just eighteen pickup locations, they're not exactly competing with McDonald's or Taco Bell.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like, if this keeps up, the Brins might become the first sub-five billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like, if this keeps up, the Brins might become the first sub-five billion dollar family in history.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just... mind-blowing when you think about where they were even a year ago.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... mind-blowing when you think about where they were even a year ago.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And Musk sitting there with his "mere" billion almost seems stable by comparison.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And Musk sitting there with his mere billion almost seems stable by comparison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Almost! But you know, Tesla's stock plummet didn't do him any favors either.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Almost! But you know, Tesla's stock plummet didn't do him any favors either.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's been a brutal year for tech wealth across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's been a brutal year for tech wealth across the board.

artist_script:
HostA: Is Elon Musk's billion-dollar fortune now making him look like the pauper of the tech world?
HostB: Well, compared to the Brin family's collective two billion, he's uh, actually doing a bit better, surprisingly.
HostA: Right, but that Brin fortune took a ten billion dollar hit in just one day after Google's stock crashed.
HostB: Yeah, that quarterly loss report really did a number on them—stock dropped nearly 10% by 1:15 PM Eastern.
HostA: And it’s wild that Mark Zuckerberg lost his title as the poorest man in the world to Bill Gates over this.
HostB: I mean, it’s all relative, right? But Google's fast-food delivery struggles aren't helping—only available in 4% of America?
HostA: Exactly, and with just 18 pickup locations, they're not exactly competing with McDonald's or Taco Bell.
HostB: It's like, if this keeps up, the Brins might become the first sub-five billion dollar family in history.
HostA: Which is just... mind-blowing when you think about where they were even a year ago.
HostB: Totally. And Musk sitting there with his "mere" billion almost seems stable by comparison.
HostA: Almost! But you know, Tesla's stock plummet didn't do him any favors either.
HostB: For sure. It's been a brutal year for tech wealth across the board.
